112.content:
You just stood there and stared in the mirror. Those were your eyes, but everything else was... wrong.

On top of the whole hairiness thing, your ears were tiny little bumps. Your nose was flat and black.

Your mouth felt weird as it was now pulled forward into an animal muzzle. You moved your tongue around in your mouth and recoiled as your teeth felt like needles.

“Otter,” you said in flat disbelief. You looked like a sea otter.

You felt heavy with the water soaked in your... fur. You scratched at it with the short, blunt... claws where your fingernails should be. The pelt was so thick you couldn’t feel all the way to the skin underneath. It looked the same color as your hair. Maybe a little sandier, but still definitely blond. Is there such a thing as a blond otter?

Okay, calm down, you thought to yourself as to took a few deep breaths.

You’d spent more time than you’d care to admit thinking about what would you’d do if were an anthro, so this shouldn’t be too shocking; even if that was just fantasy and this clearly wasn’t. Plus, you’d always wanted to be something cool, like a wolf, not those things that swim on their back at the aquarium.

Looking down, Your hands barely looked like hands. Thick webbing connected your fingers together up to about the first knuckle, making your digits look look like cute little nubs.

In fact, that was the that could be used to describe all of you: cute. You hate cute. With your tiny ears, big black triangle of a nose and plush pelt you looked like a giant stuffed animal.

Looks like that plan to get a tattoo when you graduated was out.

You wrinkled your brow and curled your thin lips into a fierce sneer, showing dozens of small pointy teeth...

Nope, still adorable. Dammit!

Physically, you look to be about the same height at around 5’9”, but definitely in better shape. Round shoulders and a wider back give you the lithe build of an olympic swimmer.

Makes sense.

A loud pounding on the door made you jump into the air and emit a little surprised squeak.

“Jesse? Are you in there?” Your dad’s voice echoed from the other side of the door.

“Y-yeah?”

“Finish up and get dressed. Dinner’s almost ready.”

Your mind raced as the real implications of your inexplicable transformation hit you. How do you explain this? You can’t! How will they react? Will they freak out?! Will you?

“Um... okay, I’ll be right out.”

You run your towel roughly over your body, trying to work the moisture out of your thick fur. This leaves you looking like an adorable ball of fluff (raaaaah!)that you struggle to smooth down.

“And don’t forget to dry off your tail,” your dad’s voice called from a few steps down the hall. “You know how your mother hates it when you get the carpet wet.”

You froze. That sentence soothed your anxiety some, only to raise all sort of new questions. Does that mean everyone somehow knew you were an otter? How? Does that mean everyone else was a furry too?

The board shorts you were wearing before were still laying rumpled on the bathroom floor, but now had a slit in back that someone, presumably Mom, had lovingly sewn into a tail hole. It took some fiddling, but you got them on easily enough.

Your t-shirt, on the other... hand had been replaced with a baggy Hawaiian shirt that you only buttoned up part way to avoid being too tight on your pelt.



You poked your head out the door looking for any other family members. Turning to look down the other end of the hall, got another start (and squeak) when you found yourself eye to eye with Kira, your older (and completely normal human) sister.

“What?” Kira said coldly as she walked away down the hall.

Okay, you thought to yourself. Kira’s still human, but she’s not freaked out that you’re not.

“Hurry up. Everyone’s dinner is going to be cold waiting on you,” she said as she kept walking.

Weird. Wonder what’s got her in such a bad mood.

You walked down the hall to the dining room as nonchalantly as a boy who’d just been turned into a giant anthropomorphic sea otter could be. Looking at the numerous family photos that lined the walls you saw one glaring difference; you weren't in any of them! You lean in to look closer. The shots and poses look the same as you remember, you’re just... not there; human or otherwise.

At the end of the hall, you finally find one picture with you in it; the newest one on the wall from last Christmas. The whole family was piled around a grinning otterboy wearing an ill-fitting santa hat that was slipping over his tiny ears.

Dammit! I hate cute!



The dining room looked the same, except the tall, stiff chair where you normally sit was missing its back. You took the cue and sat down, trying to act natural while avoiding sitting on your tail.

You failed.

You were about the say something to break the tension and maybe get a hint as to what the holy hell is actually going on, when your nose was hit by the most amazing smell you’d ever experienced. You closed your eyes to better focus on your enhanced sense of smell and the amazing aroma coming from the kitchen.

“Careful, hon. It’s still pretty hot,” your Mom said as she set a whole cooked trout down in front of you.

You could feel your tail wiggling behind you in excitement. The notion that you don't usually care for fish evaporated as you couldn't keep from drooling and wanted nothing more than to tear into this magnificent meal. Except for one thing...

“um... can I get a fork?”

Four blank faces stare back at you.

“Please?”

It was another couple seconds before Mom broke the silence.
“Of course you can, dear,” she said handing you a spare fork.
“It’s just that for as resistant as you've been in the past, we’d sorta given up on that. I’m proud of you,” Mom said as she kissed your forehead and gave your ear a scritch.

...

It’s good to remember priorities. Sure you may have taken the form of a humanoid bipedal sea otter, and have no explanation why or how your family doesn't find this odd, but dammit that trout was amazing. And it’s hard to have an existential crisis with a full belly.

The fork was a bit of challenge with the webbing and such. You could see why you’d avoided them in the past... the past you don’t remember.

Kira still shot you the occasional angry glance at dinner. Need to figure out what that’s all about.

After dinner, you spent an hour or so playing videogames with your little brother Andy, who unlike Kira, was thrilled to spend time with you.

The controller was awkward in your new webbed... let’s face it, paws, but you still managed to put your little brother in his digital; place before dad came in and sent Andy off to bed.

“Okay, furball. You too," Dad said turning to you. "You've got a big day ahead of you.”

Tomorrow is:

She was always a bit on the chubby side, but now she probably weighed over four tons, and almost touched the high ceiling every time she stood.

Most unnerving, though, was how mundane everything was. Beyond the fact that some of the people in the class have transformed into walking, talking animals, everything else seemed completely normal. Mrs. Omarah made announcements and barked instructions in the same tone she always did. Nobody else seemed to blink twice at the fact she was two stories tall now, just watching her with the same bored, apathetic expressions they always did. You try to act natural as you slink to your desk, even as you’re reevaluating your entire worldview. In your mind, two possibilities remained; either these ‘animals’ have completely taken over the world, redesigned every building, and replaced part of the population overnight, or you were going completely crazy. You weren’t sure which possibility was more terrifying.

Beyond the fact that many of your classmates had turned into animals, it was otherwise a perfectly normal school day. You, of course, weren’t in the mood to concentrate on your education right now, instead just staring at the massive animal that used to be your teacher. She wrote on the whiteboard with her long trunk, while using her hands to stuff junk food down her throat and scratch the fat rolls of her belly. Her dress just barely fit around her huge body, running up her thick thighs and straining around her huge, sagging breasts. You noticed posters on the wall warning you not to get too close to anthros her size, lest you be accidentally trampled or sat on. You decided to heed their advice.

Whenever you could, you pulled out your phone and searched for answers. According to every single source you could find online, anthros have always existed, and there are hundreds of millions of them. Most of them live in the wild, similar to real animals, but many have chosen to integrate into modern society. From what you can tell, a little less than 10% of the students and faculty at your school have been ‘replaced’ with anthros. You’re nervous as you google former economics teacher Mr. Ferguson, worried that it might turn out that he never existed, or that he’s ‘disappeared’… but no, he’s definitely still alive and kicking, just teaching at another school, for some reason. So many random little things have changed, it was hard to keep track.

Class proceeded as normally as it possibly could. When second period rolled around, you breathe a sigh of relief when you learn that your precalc teacher, at least, was still human. At lunch, you noticed all the food was either vegan, or made of synthetic meat; which made sense, in a world where animals could talk. You also noticed you seem to have a strange reputation as the son of one of the teachers, especially a teacher large enough to squash somebody with ease. It made you feared, but also unpopular. At least you didn’t have to worry about anyone picking on you.

Eventually came the moment you’ve been dreading — fourth period. You stumbled in, and sure enough, your ‘mother’ is standing at the head of the class, your old teacher nowhere to be seen. You try to evade notice, but she immediately gestures to you as you walk in. “Are you sure you’re feeling okay, sweetheart? You look a little sick,” her gross, meaty breath stung your nostrils as she kneeled down, a concerned look on her face. You just now realize how pale you’ve been all day.

“I-I’m fine, really,” you stutter, rubbing your arm, trying not to look directly at her. “Just… school, y’know?”

“Awww, baby, you’re doing just fine! Just do your best, and know I’ll always be so proud of my little boy, no matter what,” she says, in that familiar, motherly tone, “and if you need anything, I’ll always be right here to help. Okay?” You nod curtly, just trying to get this conversation over with, only to be surprised when she leaned forwards, and her huge lips plant a big, sloppy kiss right on your forehead! She meant it as a sweet gesture, but you felt humiliated as you stumbled to your desk, trying to wipe the lipstick stain off your forehead amidst the snickering of your classmates.

It wasn’t long before she started going over the lesson. She was a fine teacher, you suppose; definitely more passionate and bubbly then Mr. Ferguson ever was. You, of course, couldn’t pay attention at all, too blown away by how surreal it was to hear economic principles coming out of a hippo’s mouth, especially since that hippo seems to be your mother. While you found her new blubbery figure and atrocious BO distasteful, the more you listened to her talk, the more she just seemed like… well, your mother. She was still the same pleasant and good-natured woman as she always was, she just… looked a little different now.

You have a choice to make. Do you accept that this is just the way things are, and have always been… or do you keep stubbornly believing that the hippo isn’t your ‘real’ mother?
1223321112.title: How Deep the Rabbit Hole Goes

12233211122.content:
Maybe you were the one in the wrong here. Maybe this was the way things have always been, and you were just a little crazy. Maybe all the cherished memories you’ve had of her over the years were just… imaginary.

You shake those thoughts from your head. It’s just not possible. You couldn’t wrap your head around the idea of every single day of your life so far having been a lie. You have memories of her as a human from yesterday, for God’s sake. You remembered your mother, clear as can be, as a polite, well-mannered, graceful human woman… not some big, sloppy, obese animal. You watch in disgust as the hippo shoves junk food in her mouth while she teaches, her fat rolls heaving and jiggling as she’s overcome with gluttony. The Melanie you knew was tempered and fit. This imposter wasn’t even convincing.

You had to get your head back in the game. The hippo must be hiding your real mother somewhere out there, and you had to find her before it was too late. There wasn’t a moment to lose.

After class, you decided you couldn’t afford to waste any more time. You had to confront the hippo woman, once and for all. You were a little nervous she might just 'get rid' of you when you reveal you know she's an imposter, but there were still a few students lingering around the classroom. Surely she wouldn’t try anything while there were witnesses around, right? While the hippo sits happily at her desk, sorting through papers, you walked over and grabbed her thick, blubbery arm. “Where is my mother?” You whispered accusingly.

She seemed confused. “What?”

“Where’s my real mother?” You whispered, your voice raising as you’re filled with righteous anger. “I know you’re hiding her somewhere. You better not have hurt her. Where is she?”

“Are you okay, Jesse?” She frowns, not sure whether you’re serious or not. “I’m your mother.”

“No you’re not!” You insist, trying to restrain yourself from yelling. “You may have everybody else fooled, but you can’t be my mother! My real mother is a human, not some… hippo!”

“J-Jesse, that is extremely hurtful…” She looks upset, her voice stuttering.

“Then give me my mom back, you big, fat animal!” You angrily demand, only to realize you’d just spoken so loud, the lingering classmates could hear your clearly. They stared at you, stunned. The entire room fell silent as you all awaited the hippo’s reaction. You were still filled with anger… only to be taken aback by how she reacts.
12233211122.title: Confrontation

choices: She takes you home to see if your okay
She takes you the school nurse
122332111222.content:
...Jesse...please...” The hippo stutters on her words as a sob escapes her mouth. Her eyes started to sparkle in the fluorescent light as water started to well up in her eyes. “I don’t know...what’s happened to you...but I’m me.”

“S-stop crying.” You demand as you felt yourself almost feel bad for her. “You-you-you are not my mom, o-okay! My mom had long red hair that came to her shoulder blades. She-she has pale, white skin and was from...Kentucky! Not Africa! Everything was so normal until yesterday, and now there are walking, talking animals all over the place! And I...and I...”

Suddenly, you began to feel water creep into your eyes as well as the entire weight of your world came crashing down. “I just want my mom back!” You hell, not to the hippo, but at the universe in general. “I’m so confused! On one hand my entire life has been a lie because I can only remember having a Human for a mom, or...or...oh god!” You find your legs giving out as you fall down into the floor on your knees in a healing mess. You cupped your face as tears freely flowed out of your eyes. Nothing made sense anymore. You didn’t know what to think. Either some force had mass changed reality while you slept, or your mom was a hippo. And both of those options were ideal.

You just wanted your mom back.

The lingering students formned a semi-circle around you, but you didn’t care. You kept crying, hoping that this was all some type of dream and you wake up to your old, normal world. Suddenly, you felt yourself be hoisted up by the hem of your shirt into the air. You knew it was the Hippo but you didn’t open your eyes. You wanted to be as far away from the thing as possible. She set you down on top of her belly, with your head nestled up against her massive, saggy breasts. You tried to push her arms away when they came up behind you, but she was too strong as she pulled you into a hug.

The position you were in felt...familiar, but you couldn’t pace it to a specific memory. Ignoring the hippo’s acrid sweat, you found comfort as you sunk into the goliath’s flabby rolls. Soon, the hippo began to sing a tune, something you had wr heard in a very, very long time.

“I'll love you forever,
I'll like you for always,
As long as I'm living
my baby you'll be.“

Your mother used to sing you that when you were a kid. She read it from a book to you every night before you went to bed. You blinked hard as you slowly put your hand on the turquoise colored skin of the Hippo’s pudgy right hand. No one knew about that song. No one. Not sven your dad knew about it, mom always insisting that it would be ‘our little secret’. The only people in the world who knew about it were you and...

You looked up past the horizon of the Hippo’s cleavage. “M...mom? Is that...is that really you?”

The Hippo sniffles and wiped away a tear with a free hand. She was crying, but her mouth was smiling down at you. “Yes honey...it’s me.”
122332111222.title: She starts to cry...

choices: You spend the rest of the day at home
1223321112222.content:
“So you’re saying everyone else remembers things… differently?”

After your outburst, your mother had sent you to see the school nurse to discuss your issues, while she was busy with her work. The school nurse was, of course, a walking, talking bunny rabbit now. Guess you should have seen that coming. It was a little uncomfortable talking to her; you weren’t afraid of anthros anymore, of course, but it was a little uncanny to have a conversation with a lagomorph. “No!” You insist, before stopping yourself. It was hard to put the situation into words. “I mean… I guess. I think I remember things differently. To everyone else, this is… completely normal.”

“Would you mind describing how you remember things?” She asked, her tone indecipherable. You couldn’t tell if she believed you or not.

“Uhh… sort of the same, but… without anthros, I guess,” you shrug, awkwardly. “My mom, in particular, was… well, completely different. She was thin, tidy, polite… human.”

“Mhmm,” she said, tapping her pen on a clipboard contemplatively. “I suppose that is what led to your, ah, ‘outburst’?”

You nod shamefully. "Yeah, I... sort of thought she was some kind of alien or something trying to replace my mom." The words stung as they left your mouth, because you realize how crazy they must make you sound. Even the nurse gave you an odd look.

You discuss your symptoms for a while, before she just decided on the advice, ‘wait and see how you feel tomorrow’.

Later, your mother was speaking with the nurse in private, and you sat near the door, straining your ears to eavesdrop on their conversation. “This certainly can’t be chalked up to simple memory problems,” you can faintly hear the nurse saying. “If anything, it could be indicative of the onset of certain… delusional disorders.”

“You mean like schizophrenia?” Your mother replied, sounding alarmed.

“Well, no, not exactly. Even healthy individuals can suffer from delusional ideation. The possibility also remains that your son might be manufacturing his symptoms, for lack of a better word,” she explained in further detail. “It’s not uncommon for human children to feel insecure about having an anthropomorphic parent, especially at your son’s age. It’s also not unheard of for them to insist they’re not their ‘real’ parent. Not to say he dislikes you. Teenagers his age are simply trying to establish a concrete identity for themselves, and being split between the cultures and lifestyles of two entirely different species can be… confusing.”

Ultimately, the nurse gave your mother the same advice she gave you — wait and see how you feel tomorrow. If you’re still experiencing strange symptoms, it might be indicative of a very serious problem.

On the ride home that afternoon, you contemplate what the nurse had said. Delusional? Maybe you were delusional. That was the only way you could explain today’s events. Still, all your memories just seemed so… vivid. Could you really just be imagining them? Why did this all suddenly happen overnight? Can you trust any of your memories? Can you even know for sure what you had for breakfast this morning? “So, you… don’t have any memories of me at all?” Your mother speaks up, interrupting your introspection. “Even from back when you were little?”

“I remember you! Just… as a human,” you explain, “and some other details are a little different. But I remember the important stuff, I think.”

“Oh, dear,” she said, seeming a little bummed by the idea you might’ve forgotten some of your childhood memories. “I hope I didn’t… frighten you too much this morning.”

“It wasn’t anything you did. It’s just… it’s really scary not to recognize your own mom, you know?” More accurately, it was terrifying. Difficult to even put into words. At this age, your mother was supposed to be a stabile and comforting part of your life. To suddenly have the rug pulled out from under you had shaken you to your core. But now, even though she may seem entirely different at a glance, you know that Melanie is the same woman she always was, deep down. That knowledge felt like a massive weight had been taken off your shoulders.

“Aaww, honey…” She frowned, pulling you closer with a pudgy arm and planting another huge, sympathetic kiss right on your forehead. She didn’t know quite what to think about your ‘delusions’, but she definitely felt terrible for you. “What an awful thing for my baby to have to go through.” She sat there for a while, trying to come up with the words. You hated seeing her so sad.
1223321112222.title: Recuperation

123.content:
You stare at Andy, not believing your eyes. The other three members of your family look normal, just as you would expect. But, for some incredible and unbelievable reason, your thirteen-year-old brother does not! He sits eating his cereal like a human, he's reading the comics like a human, he's wearing clothes like a human (though you notice that his school uniform looks a little different than normal).

Of course, by now, you realize that Andy's not a human, but instead, he's...
123.title: Fuzzy Bro

choices: "...they won't let me take the bus, so you have to give me a ride!"
"...today's the day I get to shadow you at the high school!"
"...today's a day off, so you were gonna take me somewhere fun!"
1231.content:
You can't believe it: your brother's a snow leopard! He's covered with blueish-white fur with dark blueish-gray spots, and sticking out the back of his chair is a long, curly tail that slowly swishes back and forth while he eats his breakfast. His school uniform, while looking similar to the one he wore before, now is a little bit tighter around his slightly-more muscled body, and has a v-cut, revealing a little more of his chest. His blueish-tipped, slightly-rounded ears now stick out from underneath his hair, which is still shaggy and red, just like before, but it seems to be much more vibrant, although that may be just because of the contrast to his skin-- no, you correct yourself, his fur-- color.

"A-Andy!" you exclaim. "What's happened to you?"

"Hmm?" he turns his head up to you with a questioning look. "What do you mean, Jesse?"

The rest of your family turn to look at him, then look up at you. "What's wrong, Jesse?" your mother asks. "He looks normal to me!"

"B-but-- he's a cat!!" You motion towards Andy and gawk, incredulous at the rest of your family's reaction. "A -- a snow leopard, or something like that!"

Both your mother and your father exchange glances, your mother standing up and walking over to you. "Are you feeling alright, honey?" she says, placing her hands on your shoulder. "Of course Andy's a snow leopard; he's always been one!"

You're not sure how to respond to this, looking back and forth between your mom and your-- you shake your head. You still can't believe that feline in there is your brother.

Suddenly, your brother jumps up our of his seat and runs over to you. "Yeah, Jesse! Remember how I used to pounce you all the time whenever your back was turned?"

Putting his paper down, your father glances towards the two of you and chuckles. "What do you mean 'used to'? I still have to pick up the furniture after you whenever you do that."

Sticking his tongue out, Andy giggles. "Hey, I can't help it! It's instincts!"

"Now, now," your mother says, glancing at the kitchen clock. "The two of you better go and get ready to head off, or you're gonna be late!"

"Okay, Jesse," Andy says, giving you a small punch on the arm. "I'll be in your car waiting!"

"Wait," you say, rubbing your arm slightly, "why are you in my car? I mean, you're still in eight grade, right? So we go to different schools, don't we?"

"Of course we do, silly!" Andy shakes his head. "But, remember..."

12331.content:
You can't believe your eyes! He's.. he's a fox! His red hair seems more straight and short than before, but aside from that his whole body is that color! Well, minus his arms, legs, and torso. He's just sitting there, eating cereal, reading comic books.. and he's an animal. A red fox. What the hell.

You grasp at the air for a logical reason your brother has become this. His muscles are more defined, and his hands, well, paws, are tipped with sharp black claws at his slightly shorter fingers. His thumbs seem to have slightly distanced themselves from the rest of his fingers, but otherwise look just like before. Dark, tough pads dot each of his finger joints and a large one on his palms.

You notice a tuft of fur sticking out of the front of his shirt collar, and that it's got three buttons undone instead of the typical one.

"Je-jeez, And-yy.. What's happened to you?!" You yell at an uncertain volume.

Your relatives glance at Andy, then eachother, then at you.

"What are you talking about, Jesse?" Your mother asks, confused.

"He.. Andy's a fox!" Your voice cracked on that last word.

Your family thought you were making a cruel joke about your brother's species, but they heard genuine confusion in your exclamation.

"Jesse, he's always been like this. Do you need to be checked out?"

"N-no.. I don't think so-" You're interrupted by Andy.

"Yeah, come sit down before you hurt yourself, big guy." His voice has deepened incredibly. Not that it's scary, but yesterday you swore his voice was still breaking in, and now he sounds like a fifteen year old!

"Uh.. Okay.. jeez.. maybe I bumped my head today," you say, rubbing your right temple and then snagging a bite out of your cereal. You know you didn't bump your head, but it's been enough drama at the table today.

You glance at Andy a couple of times, and realize he's also gained height. His head is at your neck, when you remember his head barely reaching your shoulder when you sat down. "Jeez," you remark. Did he hit fox puberty while you were out?

"What?" Your brother asks, turning to you.

"You definitely got taller than I last remember," you tell him quietly, taking your last bite out of your bran flakes.

He looks as awkward as a new teenager could be after a compliment. "Y-yeah, I guess I'm not quite a kid anymore. Hey, you didn't forget today, right?"

"What?" you chuckle.

"You know what I mean!"

Your fox sibling explains,
12331.title: Fox

choices: Control yourself, and get to school!
Give in and show your feelings to Andy
123312.content:
"Uh.. o.. okay." You reply, rather shaken up. "Yeah.. yeah, I remember." Apparently not much has changed, besides your brother's appearance. You get up and rinse out your empty bowl after drinking the rest of the milk. You notice Andy finishes his off the way a fox would; lapping with his tongue. You stare for a moment and then shake your head, trying to focus on getting your bowl clean. After rinsing, you place it in the dry rack, before walking toward the door. Your brother passes you, and you still can't get used to the idea of him being a fox. It's just impossible.. isn't it?

You find it harder to question as you become less shaky. Your normal, conscious brain tells you that you're interested in anthros anyway, right? But that's your brother.. your.. fox.. brother. the.. one with the.. six pack and the.. fur..

You grunt as you try to control yourself. You still can't believe he's your brother, and also that he's kind of well built. Kind of hot, even, but you wouldn't say that about your sibling. Right?

You try to control yourself and convince that he is indeed your brother and that such thoughts should be reserved for boys.. uh, girls, you mean..

You can't really tell the difference anymore, because your brain is so full of stress, fear, and small amounts of lust all over that you're not sure what you want. Your mom could be a male hippo and you wouldn't really give a shit anymore.

"Jesse, let's get going." Your brother snaps you out of your confused cycle and is pushing you out the front door with your backpack. "You seem broken today, bro. What's up?" You barely detect his question as you subconsciously walk over to your car door. "Just a little tired.. stayed up to late." Complete lies. You always go to bed earliest. You don't really want to answer questions right now, though, as you have more questions yourself.

"So, you going to ninth grade next year?" You really want to ask other things, but you ask that just so you don't sound any crazier than you have already.

"Um, yeah.. I am." Andy seems not to be able to say things clearly at this point. You glance over for a moment, and then see that he's trying to adjust himself a little awkwardly. A look at his face and at his trousers clearly explain that he is aroused, yet trying to hide it.

Your previous lust arises even fiercer than before, but your mind fights, saying that it's wrong, that it's your brother! But he looks.. hot.. and he's aroused..

What do you do?
123312.title: I'm shadowing at your school!

choices: "Don't worry, you won't even notice I'm there!"
"I'll stick close to you, maybe you can show me around?"
1233121.content:
You shake your head and try and clear your mind, it works but your not sure for how long. Andy looks at you again curiously as you walk up to your car and get inside, with him getting into the passenger seat. He places his bag down on his lap, and pulls on his seat belt, you couldn't help but look over at him again before turning on the car. The drive to school was a long one, much longer than what you remember, though you were lucky the traffic going there was pretty light. The thoughts of your newly changed brother still fresh on your mind.

You turn to Andy, who seems to have been looking out the window, his ears perked up. "Hey, do you remember that time, we played hide and seek." You ask him, seeing if the change is as complete as is appears.

Your fox brother turns to look at you, his brow arch's up a moment before thinking. "Of course, what I remember most of all are the times I managed to sneak right up on, and you weren't any the wiser." He snickers at that, the glint in his eyes taking on a mischievous shine.

"Oh yeah, of course Andy, but there's been plenty of times I found you!" He pouts playfully at that mention and shrugs.

"Well, I can only hide in bushes so well, with red-orange fur, you know that, besides I let you find me a few times." He smiles, and looks at you for a moment.
"Are you sure you are okay Jesse?" He tilts his head, worry creeping into his voice.

You briskly nod at him and smile gingerly, or at least try to with out looking on any longer at his furry form. "Yeah I'm fine!"

When the next light came up, you had to adjust your pants again, the school wasn't that much father now, and you made sure to take note of any pedestrians reactions to your brother. Everyone around there seemed to be familiar with him, waving his or your way as they walked and you drove past. You were really starting to wonder if you were the only one that remembered things any differently.

When you stop the car again to look at your brother, you catch him trying to sneak another peek at you, adjusting his shorts this time again before he finally notices you looking. He freezes and turns his head away, and you choose not to say anything about that.

"Andy, you been working out or anything?" You ask, trying to break the current silence.

He turns his head back, after peering at the school getting closer, and you pull into the parking lot. "Oh yeah, I have been a bit, though I'm told I have quite a bit more growing to do, you might end up looking up at me before long, Jesse."

You park the car and freeze a moment, only to hear the door open and your furry brother slip out and stand there. "Don't worry, big bro, I'll try not to embarrass you in front of your friends."

You sit there, those thoughts of your brother still on your mind, and your left wondering what to do, some space from Andy would give you time to think, but he's still your brother, and he's supposed to be shadowing you.

Turning to him again, he pipes up...
1233121.title: Control yourself, and get to school!

12331211.content:
His words give you some momentary assurance, and you can manage to not stare at him for a while. Your brother is only a few feet behind you, but you wonder if he's staring. The thought of it gives a spark in your head which you decide not to provoke. He just has to affect you in every way ALL day, doesn't he? You think to yourself, before opening the metal door that leads into the main hall. It's when you hold the door open and Andy walks past that you notice he's in his uniform for middle school, but he's shadowing at his high school.

         "You didn't really need to wear your uniform to a high school, did you? Not like we have them."

         "School says I have to," replies Andy. "It apparently distinguishes me from the actual enrolled students."

         You feel a little bad for Andy; chances are, he's not going to actually want to be picked out from the other students.

         "You shouldn't have to," you say, a little upset at the system. "You're already different enough from the students here."

         "I know, but that makes my uniform less obvious. Just looks like part of me, not part of a school." Wise saying, bro. You never would've thought that way if you were in his position.
Then again, he doesn't notice his species, so he's about as human as I am - ignorant of what I am, and focusing on who I am.

         "What are you, a fashion trend?" You jokingly say as you bump his shoulder with your fist.

         Your brother laughs and pushes you back, and you both arrive at your first class.
12331211.title: "Don't worry, you won't even notice...

choices: Your gym clothes are even tighter on Andy-- he's grown during the class
Andy is being a little more handsy with you than usual
123312111.content:
You had always felt that having gym first period was the best part of your schedule. You liked getting a nice workout first thing in the morning; it really helped you get your blood pumping for the rest of the day. Today, though, with Andy shadowing you, you suddenly realized that this class may present some... complications.

Of course, one presents itself almost as soon as you step into the locker room to change into your gym clothes. "Hey, Jesse? I ... uh... I wasn't told to bring a change of clothes or anything."

You stop and turn around to face your brother. All around you, the rest of the guys are already half-changed. Some of them glance up at your brother, but none seem particularly surprised. "Damn, you're right. Hang on a second." Opening your locker, you're relieved to see that you still have a spare set of clean gym clothes, one you had put there in case you had accidentally left your main one at home on laundry day. "Here," you say, handing the t-shirt and shorts to him, "they may be a bit loose, but they should fit."

"Thanks!" he exclaims, and the two of you begin to remove your street clothes. As you do, you can't help but look at Andy's body out of the corner of your eye. Yes, that definition you saw earlier is certainly there, and the white belly and chest fur really serve to accentuate his abs. After a moment, Andy looks up at you with a wry smile on his face, and you realize that you've been staring a little longer than you should. You turn back to focus on changing your own clothes, though you're pretty sure that Andy's also watching you as you do.

"Alright," you say once you're fully changed and have put your street clothes in the locker. "How does that--" You stop, surprised to see that the gym clothes Andy was wearing were now as snug on him than they were on you, maybe even slightly more! But that would mean-- you gulp as you realize you're staring Andy straight in the eye-- he's as tall as you are.

"What's the matter, Jesse?" he asks, smiling softly at you as he places his hands-- paws? -- on his hips... just on either side of a very pronounced bulge.

"Well, uh..."

Before you can answer, you hear the whistle of Coach Mallarson, your teacher, and the few guys who're still in the locker room hurry out to the field outside. "I guess that means we have to go, huh?" Andy asks.

You nod, following the rest of the group, still a little dazed as you stand in a line as Coach Mallarson starts the class. Nothing about this made any sense at all. You know your brother was a head shorter than you just this morning, and he was even shorter than that before this whole fox craziness started. You thought about what he said in the car: "I'm told I have quite a bit more growing to do, you might end up looking up at me before long, Jesse." Sure, kids his age had growth spurts, but this much was ridiculous, wasn't it?

Your mind is so caught up with these thoughts that you totally miss Coach Mallarson telling you what today's class is covering, and as he blows his whistle, you're a little confused as everyone, including Andy, starts to jog towards the track circling the soccer field. Not wanting to get in trouble, you start running along with them. After a moment's confusion, you remember that this is the day that everyone in the class is supposed to run 5 miles.

Not exactly the day you were looking forward too over the past few weeks, but it suddenly seems oddly appealing. After all, running is mindless enough, and it gives you time to further think about your situation... and to watch your brother. Andy runs right along with the high schoolers, his tail (which is sticking just out of the top of the pants, revealing a little more than is probably appropriate for PE class) flies behind him like the tail of a kite, and he soon takes the lead of the group. As the other boys fatigue, he seems to be full of energy, almost keeping a sprinter's pace the entire way. What's more, he seems to really be enjoying himself.

Is it really so bad to be attracted to him, you think to yourself as you watch him. I mean, on one level, yes, he's your brother-- but you certainly can't be physically related to him anymore, right? I mean, whatever's happened in this crazy alternate universe (if that's what it is), he would have be adopted or something, wouldn't he? And, from all the signals he's been giving you all morning, he certainly seems to be reciprocating your feelings. But maybe that's just wishful thinking.

At the end of the class, Andy finishes several minutes ahead of anyone else, and as you complete the final lap in the middle of the pack, he runs over to you, a huge smile beaming across his muzzle. At first, you think he's about to give you a hug, but instead, he simply pats you on the shoulder. "That was fun!" he says, and you notice that he's panting ever so slightly.

"Yeah... fun." Somehow, you can't disagree with him on that.

As you head back into the locker room, however, you begin to notice something...

1233121112.content:
It seems no matter how much time passes, Andy has had the spotlight. Your morning has gone freakishly–you still idly wonder to yourself if it's even started yet, or if you've really just entered some coma dream–and no matter how long you've waited, how long you've hoped, the harsh reality of Andy has been harder and harder to avoid - and that's not to mention some other departments.

         You're about to accept that there is almost certainly a nervous breakdown in your future, but the faint touch of four soft pads grazing the side of your ear shocks every one of your senses into an alertness that makes you swear your ears are ringing. You nearly whine as you, for what feels like the first time, face the darling expression on your little brother's… on your brother's face.

         "Jesse," he nearly murmurs with a soft-spoken huskiness, softly tracing his paw around to your chin. Your ears barely make out his plea.

         "I'm really worried about you."

         His eyes–they're as high up as yours, you're reminded–are glimmering. You can see both sets of whiskers push forward, and his dark lips separate ever so slowly as he awaits an answer. His head is tilted to the side. You're burning up.

         You close your mouth and discreetly bat his arm away while trying to avoid any eye contact with him. "I'm– I am fine," you reply rather tersely. Maybe it was wishful thinking, but as you stroll past him you swear you saw his paw reach for your hand.

         "I need a minute," you huff at the air, trying to walk off the agitated heat rapidly building in your chest.

         In the changing room, things don't prove to be much better as the slam of lockers is overpowered by the cry of something not quite resembling the shrillness that you used to constantly hear through your home.

         "Jesse, what the hell?"

         "Andy, what?" You wheel around and bark with a little more volume than you planned. As if you didn't already startle everyone by rushing into the locker room with a fire lit under your ass.

         "You're– you're never like this, Jess; you've just been really weird all morning, and–"

         "I don't have time for this, Andrew; please, just–"

         "Would you stop trying to act like I'm under you?! This happens every time you get pissed! You are two years my senior! I–"

         Coach Mallarson's arrival to the scene was just enough to shock you out of rushing your own brother, but it's when you calm down that you really see how hurt your brother is. Perhaps the most glaring thing was the last thing he tried to say.

         Perhaps it was the fact that Andy was four years younger than you.

         As Andy wipes his eyes, as Coach defuses the situation, all you can think about is the error in math. If it was true, that would make him fifteen - or it would make you fifteen; either way, it was just wrong. He said the wrong number, that was all. What even was all that they discussed about his middle school? So, he misspoke. It's the only way everything made sense.

         And yet, a voice in the back of your head whispers, evidence to the contrary is staring you straight in the face.

         With a profane scream, your friend's locker is busted, and your fist is bandaged for the remainder of the day.


~~~


         You can't tell if you're relieved that Andy isn't shadowing many of the same classes as yours. While it removes the stress of interacting with him again, all it does is leave you with the tug of war that is your conscience. Oh, and don't forget your little existential crisis there, too.

         Your fist throbs, and you're worried that you might have hurt it much worse than you initially thought. It's all you can stand to think about as your teacher drones on, and you grip your bound hand even as the lunch bell makes the ringing in your ears worse. Exchanging the books in your locker is nearly cathartic, and you almost forget your troubles until their very voice pipes up and scares the daylight out of you.

         "Andy, for god's sake–"

         "Jesse, please, shut up for a second. I want you to listen to me." You resume placing books into your locker. You swear you can hear the blood rushing in your ears.

         "Jesse…" You feel his paw on your shoulder, his grip insistent.

         "…are you mad at me?"

         Your gaze turns to him, and he's more pitiful than ever. His tail is tucked, and he's almost clutching his notebook at his chin.

         Your heart sinks as you scramble for words. "No! I mean, I wasn't– I'm n-not… mad. At you." His head tilts, and you nearly piss yourself.

         "I mean – I'm not mad at anyone! Shit. I'm– I'm mad at my– myself, a little," you stammer.

         You jump a little as he places his paw on your hand; you can't get over how soft it is. The touch is short enough to be inconspicuous, but it's an intimate one.

         "Calm down. And apology accepted, by the way," he quips, giving a sideways smile.

         "Christ, Andy. I'm sorry. I've just… there's a whole lot going on–"

         You find yourself being pushed down the hallway with unexpected force, and it takes you a second to resist it. "Less talking; more eating!" Andy cries.

         You're startled both by his strength and the lengths he seems to be going to in order for you to put a sock in it, but as you yelp and try to push back against him, it's almost familiar. Something about this still feels like Andy, you realize, and like all the things that are different, you feel equally as anxious acknowledging all the things that are still the same.


~~~


         That's my brother, alright, you marvel to yourself as he puts away half his plate before stopping to suck down his chocolate milk bottle. His method of drinking it from the bottle stuns you for a second, leaving you wordless as he asks whether or not you care for hot dogs. Your only response is to slowly hand over yours while your eyes discreetly trail down to the rest of him.

         About now you notice the fact that he changed back into his uniform while you were busy in the nurse's office. His shirt sleeves, which only come about two inches down his arm, now hug his biceps, and you look down and see that his shirt is only half tucked - it's not nearly long enough for his shorts, which nearly stop at the middle of his thighs.

         "So, Andy…"

         You see his ears stand up in response, close to finishing his second weenie.

         "You ever, uh, pay attention to the fact that you look like you… er, outgrew all your clothes?" Your heart momentarily beats faster and you half expect him to suddenly scream in realization.

         "Shranck in th' wash," he shoots back with a full mouth.

          "…Ah," you reply under your breath with a nod. That was less intense than it was building up to be, you feel. You still can't help but look him up and down, mildly hypnotized by how his uniform shirt hugs his lithe figure, threatening to come up with his sleeves if he were to raise his arms–

         "Aren't you going to eat?"

         Your eyes snap back up to his, and you feel truly ashamed. You were actually ogling your brother. But that retort still hangs in your head; if he wasn't human, then I mean how could…?

         But… no, why are you even entertaining the thought? You have no plans on even giving that proposition the time of day. It… it means nothing if you two are related - you're never going to–

         "Earth to Jesse!" He snaps his fingers in front of your face. You're momentarily intrigued that he's capable of snapping.

         "Huh, what'd you ask?"

         He rolls his eyes. "You aren't eating. What, you're gonna tell me you aren't hungry after exercising in the morning?"

         You scoff. "Oh, like that was exercise for you. You were practically bouncing afterward," you counter with a grin.

         "Are you trying to deny food from a growing pup?" He laughs and leans into your face, mock growling. For a moment, your eyes widen, and you feel uncomfortably warm at how close he is.

         "Back off, fido, I'm not on the menu," you laugh as you push him at arms length. He then opens his maw wide, threatening to close his jaws on you, before leaning over and giving a long, deep smooch on your lips.

         You can't help but gasp. You're unsure if what happened actually happened.

         …Did your brother just kiss you?

         You bring your hand halfway toward your mouth, staring at his mischievous grin. Your breath picks up and your fingertips tingle, the sensation spreading up your arms and pooling in your chest as you try to get your mind under control. His expression is almost innocent, and you feel yourself halfway to giving long, hard looks at places you know they aren't supposed to go.

         You're about to shut your eyes when the next thing to happen manages to shock you further, as you weren't sure if you were just hearing yourself go deaf or if the lunch bell really was ringing. Your brother perks up before scooping up both of your trays, sliding one on top of the other, and patting you on the shoulder with a hearty laugh. You can't seem to crane your neck hard enough as he disappears into the crowd of moving students.
1233121112.title: Handsy Andy

12331211121.content:
As you sit down for your first class after lunch, you're glad that Andy's not shadowing your next class, as you highly doubt you'd be able to concentrate on anything if he was in the same room as you. As the teacher starts to drone on about something something World War I, however, you find yourself zoning out and replaying the end of lunch over and over in your mind. The hottest kiss you've ever had.

No stop that, he's my brother for god's sake. Still, as much as you try to push the thought out of your mind, you keep coming back to it, each time lingering a little longer on the kiss, each time feeling a bit more of Andy's warm chest pressing against yours.

It's wrong, you remind yourself. And yet, it didn't feel that way, at least instinctively. On a logical level, sure, everything about this feels as wrong as could be. Your brother is supposed to be four years younger than you, almost a foot shorter, totally not someone you had the hots for (or vice-versa). And, oh yeah, he's a human, not some sort of fox creature!

But, apparently, you're the only one who finds this the least bit strange. Your parents, everyone at school, Andy himself-- they all seem to be reacting to this as if everything's completely normal. That was the strangest thing of all. And yet, what if this is normal? Would that be so bad?

Your mind is so flooded with conflicting thoughts, questions, and emotions, that you don't notice that your teacher is now staring at you with a stern look on his face. "Well, Jesse," he says as he folds his arms across his chest, "do you have any guess as to what the significance of the Lusitania was? Maybe if you had done the reading..." Gulping, you shake your head, feeling too light-headed to form any coherent reply. "Are you alright, Jesse?" your teacher finally asks, his frown softening a little

"A-actually, is it okay if I go use the bathroom and get a drink of water?" you finally manage to blurt out, feeling sweat begin to bead on your forehead.

Rolling his eyes, your teacher motions towards the door. "Make it quick," he says, as you leap to your feet.

A few minutes later, you're hunched over the sink, splashing your face with water as cold as you could make it. Looking into the mirror, you notice your cheeks are flush, and your heart is pounding. You reach out for a paper towel to dry your face, you close your eyes and take a deep breath. "Stay calm," you whisper to yourself, repeating it softly as you try to get your emotions under control.

"Well, well, isn't this a coincidence?"

The familiar voice behind you causes your heart to start racing again. Opening your eyes, you spin around to see Andy grinning mischieviously behind you. You audibly gasp, surprised not only to see him at all, but also to realize he's now looking down at you, several inches taller than he had been at lunchtime. His shirt is now almost skin tight, completely untucked with a noticeable rift of orange and white fur visible around his stomach. Several of the buttons on his chest seem to be ready to pop off at any moment, and you wonder how he could even walk comfortably without causing any of it to rip.

Andy seems not to notice or care about that all -- indeed, all his attention is fixed on you. Glancing to the side, you realize that the two of you are alone in the bathroom - a fact that Andy seems to also be all too aware of.

"A-Andy!" you finally exclaim. "W-what are you doing here?"

"I had to use the bathroom, brainiac," he giggles. "Seems like I picked the right time to too." He takes a step closer to you, causing you to lean back against the still-running sink. "Imagine, Jesse, when I go here we could be together like this like every day!"

You can't think of anything to say in reply to that, and Andy takes your silence as a cue to take another step closer, reaching out and placing his paw on your shoulder. Your brain says you should be frightened by having someone who's now bigger than you in this position -- but every other part of you is incredibly turned on. And judging by the bulge he now has pressed against your stomach, the same is true with him.

"W-wait. " you finally say, softly pushing him away. "Andy, we can't..."

The look of disappointment in his soft green eyes and the slight drooping of his ears tears you up inside. "Why, Jesse? What's wrong?"

"I -- I mean," you gulp, "we are brothers, after all..."

The corners of his lips turn upward slightly as his whiskers twitch, as he says...
12331211121.title: You can't get the kiss off your mind.

123312111212.content:
"…N–No, Andy, we are," you struggle quietly. You reach for his chest, shocked at the tautness of his shirt fabric, nearly unyielding amidst his broad, older chest. It's enough to make you whimper a little as your eyes dart up to his. His muzzle is close enough to pick up the soft musk of his fur, and you close your eyes as he separates your legs with his own. With a fevered, soft gasp, you feel yourself losing the battle as your length slides up against your waistband, throbbing hotly against the weight of his knee.

         You gulp and shudder a little. You can't deny that you're starting to lose control of your breath as your chest feels like it's being filled with a warm relaxant. These feelings, the way they're worming through you and seizing your muscles, making you shaky, making your voice tighten as he leans into you, eliciting a quiet groan as your thighs buckle and slide down the sink…

         "A-Andy," you whisper. You try to say no; to yourself or to him, you're not sure. You know you want to tell him to stop, but it's almost like the more you're around him, the more infectious he is. Of course– of course you want to tell him to stop… but… every move he makes seems to make you feel more exposed… it's too late to say anything, isn't it…? You… you so badly want to… to tell him to stop… but his warm paws are rubbing your arms, now… and your eyes are starting to flutter as they caress your sides…

         "I know you've liked me for a while, now," Andy murrs. You whine quietly as his paws pull up your shirt, sliding his silky pads and downy fur across your chest. The back of your head is nearly touching the mirror, and you moan pitifully as he buries his muzzle into your neck, giving soft nibbles and kisses all the way to your shoulder. His velvety ears flick against yours, and you start to become aware of his paws hooking around the hem of your pants – dangerously close to your raging hard-on.

         Staring up at you lustfully, your brother slides his chest down yours, nuzzling his whiskers against your pale skin after each affectionate peck - meanwhile stopping to give soft licks. You can't take it; you grip the sink and moan. It's too much, and with a panting glance downward, you can see that your brother knows it. He gives you a sultry smile while his paw massages your groin, and you cry out weakly.

         "A… Andy–!"

         "I would hope my younger brother would know better than to try and hide these things from me," he begins, giving that familiar look of mischief. "After all, wasn't I the one who discovered your hidden girlfriend?"

         It takes a few seconds to register, but you know for a fact you're not hearing things this time. You stare down at him with wide eyes.

         Younger. He called you his younger brother.

         Your mind is reeling yet again. Your brother keeps growing and, it seems, passing you up in age entirely – all without thinking anything of it. And, frankly, you're beginning to suspect his age and size aren't the only things practically doubling between encounters – you're having a harder and harder time suppressing the overt attraction that has been undeniably building between you two.

         It's exactly this that's becoming the immediate problem: you're starting to sense that if Andy keeps this up, you might not be able to control yourself before he even gets your pants undone. It's one thing to have to wrestle with feelings for someone you shouldn't have feelings for, but letting Andy get you off would only serve to complicate the issue… and you're not going to have a choice in the matter if you don't act soon.
123312111212.title: "Well... we're not {i}really{/i} brothers."

choices: Algebra, and Andy has a separate class from you this time

123312112.content:
You were glad to have Spanish first, since it would give Andy some slack. You know that your teacher Mrs. Maria will understand. She taught you for your first year of high school. She's as sweet as can be when she can be, but she gets strict quickly with students who didn't live up to her expectations. Her expectations were low for those who didn't procrastinate a lot, but by that standard it was pretty high for just about everyone.

         You hold the door open for Andy again, but he doesn't seem to be as upbeat as he usually is. You watch him go sit in the front left corner, and you decide to sit down next to him. You walk over to the neighboring desk, and as you drop off your bag in front of it, your brother asks you a question you didn't quite hear.

         "Repeat that, Andy?"

         "You sure you want to sit next to me?" he asks. "I mean, you seemed pretty freaked out this morning about being near me and all.."

         You see his constant smile missing from his face, and his ears seem to be out of his control when it comes to emotion.

         "Aw, man, you know I like being around you! It's just.. well, I'll tell you about it later." His expression remains forlorn.

         You hesitate for a moment, and it feels like an adrenalized eternity before you hug him and pat him on his back. He just remains rigid for a couple of seconds, and then pats you back before pulling a bit tighter. "Thanks, Jess. I guess I just feel a little neglected, and then I don't know many people at this school, so I just felt a bit lonely." You almost forget to break the hug, but you remember in just enough time to be less than awkward.

         "Anything for a brother of mine," you say, smiling. He gives you a smile that just makes you want to tackle him and cuddle, so you look away and shake your head a little violently. He's your sibling; get ahold of yourself. You begin to wonder if he's actually biologically related to you now, before he interrupts your thought.

         "Jesse.. I.." He hesitates for a while. He has a determined yet sad look in his eye. "I.. I know-" The shrill ring of the bell interrupts him, and not long after, Ms. Maria comes in. You hoped he would continue, but Ms. Maria is already speaking about the agenda when she walks in, so you give an 'it's fine' look to your brother before adjusting yourself back into your seat.

         "Hola, buenos tardes!" Your class responds the same. "Cómo estás?" She asks to Andy. He hesitates for a moment before replying, "Muy.." Mrs. Maria finishes with "..bien. Muy bien."

         You thought about how you haven't seen any other anthropomorphic animals around, yet you wonder why everybody everywhere seems to have already acknowledged his species for a while now. You think that maybe since the people in your neighborhood and town are so tight knit together, they've gotten used to it in the past thirteen years. Who knows?

         The rest of class drags on as you practice math in your head to keep your mind off of Andy. When that didn't work, you played piano on your fingers. Finally, you sat back in your seat and glanced over at Andy. Mrs. Maria allowed him to work on other things for the time being since he hadn't taken Spanish class since the sixth grade.

         You notice Andy's shorts tented again, and his nerves show in his ears again. You think back to yourself reading that vulpines have a much higher drive and sensitivity to any stimuli than humans are, and you convince that to yourself to keep yourself distracted from your sibling. You swear you're not gay. You've had a couple of girlfriends before, and have even come close to having relations with one. But you just couldn't keep your mind off of Andy. Your frustration builds until it seemingly ejects from your body in the form of ringing.

         The ringing turned out to be the bell for next hour, which shocked you out of your train of thought. You turn around to see Andy gazing off with his eyes half closed and a pleasant smile on his face, and his eyebrows are slightly upward.

         "Andy?" He doesn't respond. "Andy. Come on." You poke him on the shoulder and he blinks and looks around.

         "You wanna tell me what you were going to earlier?" He stares at you for a moment and says, "Well.. later.. I'll tell.. I'll tell you later." He looks like he would be blushing right now as he gets up and grabs his bag. You look at him with one furrowed brow and then do the same as he heads out the door. You catch up to him, and you stand next to him. You look at him, and he seems to dart his eyes back and forth like he's going to say something.

         "Look, dude, whatever you're going to say, I won't hold it against you. It's not like anything is going to change, alright?"

         Andy hesitates for a good 5 seconds, before saying, "Jesse, can we talk about it after school?" You nod, before he unexpectedly hugs you tightly. You are caught off guard, but you hug him back. He sniffs a seemingly teary sniff before pulling tighter. "I promise you, Andy, we can talk about it." You ruffle his hair - really just slightly longer fur on the top of his head - before letting go.

         "Just promise me you can keep it together for the rest of the day." You really do mean this. Those fox eyes give you the most pitiful feeling. Please stop, Andy. You're gonna make me cry. Don't make me cry, Andy.

         The momentary humor in your head lets you give a smile, which serves to assure Andy into nodding. "I will, Jess." He holds your hand for a moment, before letting go. Fear rockets up and down your spine, then embarrassment soaks into it, while all the time you want to hold it longer. You pat him on the shoulder without looking, lest you lose control of yourself. You decide to go in front of him mainly to avoid looking suspicious, but as you approach the classroom, Andy jogs past you and holds the door open for you instead. He smiles at you a little more than friendly with his eyebrows raised, while you pull an awkward smile before rushing a little fast into..
123312112.title: Banished to Spanish

12332.content:
You were startled when you saw something strange and misshapen move quickly in your peripheral vision; something obviously not human, and in fact, not like any creature you’ve ever seen before. With a glance, you realize it was some kind of bipedal creature with thick brown fur… and it was coming right at you! “Aaaah!” You scream in surprise, jumping back. Your scream seems to startle the creature, and it freezes in place, staring at you wide-eyed. “What the hell is that!?”

The whole family was looking at you strangely now, as if taken aback by your outburst. They didn’t seem to even notice the furry creature standing in the middle of the dining room. “Hey! S-stay back!” You cried out when the animal took a step closer.

“Jesse, get a hold of yourself!” Your mother demanded. “He’s your brother!” You realize that the creature seemed to be wearing your brother’s uniform. Was this some sort of joke?

“This isn’t funny! Keep it away from me!” You cried. You’d always been nervous around large animals, and at around five feet, this one looks like it could maul you. However, to your surprise, it spoke.

“J-Jesse?” The bipedal animal whimpered, and you were shocked to hear your brother’s voice coming from its mouth. Before you could respond, the shivering animal started sobbing loudly, covering its face with its paws as it turned away from you.

“That’s it, mister!” Your mother stood up, pointing at you angrily. “Out of this kitchen! Out, out, out!” Dazed and confused, you were herded easily out of the kitchen, forced out into the living room. Meanwhile, your mother bent over to soothe the crying animal. “Oh… it’s okay, sweetheart… don’t cry...”

Shellshocked, you walk over and sit on the couch, your mind unable to process what you had just seen. What was that creature? It looked like a human, but… not. Why did it have your brothers voice, and your brother’s uniform? You dwell on these questions for a while until your father stomps into the room. “What has gotten into you!?” He says, barely restraining his anger. “Andy’s bawling his eyes out! He thinks you’re scared of him now!”

“That’s Andy?” You said, your heart sinking. Why would your brother have fur now? Something terrible must’ve happened to him — something disfiguring. “What happened to him?”

“What do you mean, ‘what happened to him’?” He raised a brow.

“He’s an… he’s an…” You insist. “... animal now!”

He freezes, as if in disbelief at what you just said, before narrowing his eyes. “Jesse, I am extremely disappointed in you. I don’t know if you think this is funny or whatever, but the poor boy gets bullied enough as it is,” he said as he rubbed his forehead, with that familiar restrained anger in his voice. “Now, when you get home from school, you are grounded from your electronics, from going out, from everything. You’ll use the free time to make things up to your little brother. Do you understand?”

“Dad…” You stuttered, confused and overwhelmed. Why is he treating this like it’s completely normal? You just want answers. “You don’t… understand…”

“No, I don’t understand why you’re acting this way. But you’re putting a stop to it, right now. There is nothing wrong with your brother, and I don’t want to hear you say a word otherwise,” your father insists, his voice shaking as he tries to subdue his anger. “Now go eat breakfast. You have to be at school in thirty minutes.” Despite your confusion, his tone of voice makes it clear that arguing with him wouldn’t be a good idea, so you slink shamefully back into the kitchen.

You notice your mother comforting Andy in the back. When he sees you, he darts away, as if hiding from you. You almost feel a little guilty, but confusion dominates your mind first and foremost. Even at school that day, the curious condition of your brother still haunted you, distracting you from class completely. You’ve always been a big fan of anthropomorphic animals; perhaps that has something to do with it? Then again, you didn’t think such animals existed, and certainly didn’t think your brother was one of them. In all of your memories, as far back as you can remember, he was human.

In your question for information, you try asking some of your friends and peers. According to everyone you talk to, ‘anthros’ are people who were born with a rare medical condition that gives them animal features, and your brother has always been one. One of your friends even notes off-hand that Andy is an otter, which further intrigues you. Otters had always been your favorite animals. That couldn’t just be a coincidence, could it? Perhaps your wish to meet an anthro in real life had finally come true, in the most unexpected of ways.

Whenever you had a chance, you tried to search online for anything that might explain why you remember Andy so differently from everyone else. In all your searches, a single phrase reappeared; the mandela effect. Most of it didn’t seem applicable to your situation, but one idea intrigued you; the theory that those with these different memories might be travellers from another timeline altogether. If that’s true, then you weren’t misremembering this; it’s just Andy’s always been an anthro in this timeline. Surely, such a theory was ridiculous… but you couldn’t come up with any better explanations.

As you drove back home, you decided to just act natural from here on out. Maybe you’ll just have to get used to the fact that this is the way things are now. Regardless of what his species may be, Andy is still Andy. You return home to find the house strangely hush, your sister on the couch in the living room, giving you a strange look. Your brother seemed cheerful as ever, though, curled up on his bed with a comic book. “Hey, Andy,” you said awkwardly, standing in the doorway.

Now that you have a better look at his new form, he doesn’t look so bad. He looked just like, well, Andy, but with fur and a tail. His face looked different, too, with a black, button nose and big, brown eyes; it was actually kind of adorable. You didn’t know why you were so scared of him earlier. This was your first chance to meet a real anthro! “O-oh, hey, Jesse,” he says, giving you a fake smile, although it was obvious he was nervous. Seeing just how timid he was around you now made you feel like a monster.

“Look, Andy. I’m really, really sorry about how I acted this morning. I’ve just been all messed up lately, and I wasn’t thinking straight,” you say, rubbing the back of your head, “and, uh… I want to make it up to you.”

“S-so… you’re taking me to the pool?” He asks, perking up.

You stare at him, confused. “... what?”

“Oh, well, I just figured… I mean, the pool’s my favorite place, so…” He deflects, looking a little embarrassed to have jumped the gun. You were still confused. Since when did Andy love the pool so much? He hated swimming. Then you realized; he’s an otter now. Of course he likes swimming. You wonder what other things have changed in this timeline.

“... alright, let’s go to the pool,” you sigh.

He instantly leapt into the air in excitement! “Woohoo!” He cheers, his demeanor changing completely. You chuckled, walking off and letting the otter get ready. You never saw human Andy get so excited over something so small. Perhaps this change wasn’t so bad after all...

There was no doubt about it, your sister had the visage of a lioness. You stared at her in disbelief as she made her way to the kitchen and prepared a simple breakfast of cereal. Instinctively you knew that it was your older sister but you couldn't get over the fact that she had somehow transformed into an anthropomorphic lion overnight. Even worse was how you were the only one that was noticing the change.

It looked like her hair had receded and redistributed itself across her whole body as she was now covered in sandy-blonde fur resembling that of a lion, the fur lightening a bit on her front. She was wearing a loose white tank top and some shorts, the clothing showing off her fit physique that was still visible under her short fur. Trying not to stare at her toned, fuzzy legs you noticed that her feet had been replaced with a pair of digitgrade paws and that a tawny tail was swaying low behind her.

Kira also now had a strong feline-like muzzle and as she started pouring the cereal into a bowl she let out a yawn that showed off her white pointed teeth and long rough tongue. Her rounded ears were flat against her head which made her look grumpy, though it was more likely she had not fully woken up yet. Or at least you hoped; her new animal facade gave her the look of a predator and you would hate to end up at the end of those teeth or the sharp claws she now had.

Eventually she had got her breakfast ready and sat down at the table to eat. In a fit of confusion you just pointed at her. "You're a lion?"

Kira lazily turned to face you, looking very unamused. Her irises had also changed colour to a vibrant gold and they bored into you as she stared. "What?"

"Why are you a lion?"

"Don't be rude," Wesley interjected.

"Yeah, are you trying to make some kind of joke or something? Because I don't get it," Kira said. Her tail was flicking about behind her like an annoyed cat.

You looked between the rest of your family. Were they really unaware that she transformed overnight into an apex predator from the African savannahs? "No really, before today you were a human just like us. Am I really the only one noticing this?"

More confused looks were exchanged around the table. Suddenly, a chair skid along the ground as Kira stood up and moved towards you, grabbing your arm and dragging you to the next room over. She guided you back against a wall and leaned over you with one of her hands pressed against the wall above you. Among the other changes you were sure that she must have gained a few good inches of height as well which only made her look more intimidating as she stood over you. You just meekly stood there as she stared at you with her golden eyes.

Before long she broke the silence.

﻿Another drab Monday, you thought to yourself as you walked the halls on your way to your locker. Beige halls, grey uniforms. It was looking like another monotonous, uneventful day.


Well, other than explaining to your girlfriend why you had to bail on plans to hang out over the weekend. Hopefully that wasn't going to be too big of a fight.

Your locker was a wreck. None of the lockers in your school looked pristine by any means, but your’s and your’s alone looked like it'd been worked over with a bat. Dents and scratches had taken off a fair amount of the paint.


Multi-colored flecks speckled the door, as if numerous layers of graffiti had been scrubbed away.


You looked a bit closer and saw the word “pervert” clumsily scratched into the door.


Your best friend Dallas paid you no mind as he pulled his books out of the adjacent locker.


"Hey, did something go on here this weekend," you said motioning to your vandalized locker.


“Really? You’re still surprised at this point? You really are dense, aren't you?"


Dallas walked off to class, giving his locker door a melodramatic slam as he went. Leaving you to just stand and wonder what that was all about.


"So, how was your weekend?"


You froze for a second when you heard Selena's voice. You didn't hear her walk up behind you. Time to face the music.


You took a deep breath. She didn’t sound too angry. You pasted on your best smile and turned to smooth things over

1322.content:
You just stood there, mouth hanging open a bit. There was a large bipedal cougar girl standing in front of you, in a school uniform no less, looking rather cross at you.


You were frozen hard this time. The seemingly logical part of your brain wanted to flee in response to being two feet away from a dangerous predator. The rest was just struck dumb from the sheer oddity of the situation.


Out the corner of your eye you could see other students shuffling past, paying this surreal encounter with no more than a few disapproving glances. Why wasn't anyone doing anything?!


"What's the matter? Has it been so long you don't recognize me?"


That was Selena's voice.


Looking closer, that was Selena's wavy black hair. Those were her sparkling green eyes.


And that was clearly the locket you'd gotten her for her birthday, but instead of a chain, it was now set on a black, collar-like choker tight around her cream-colored throat.


"S-Selena?"


Two pointy ears poked out from her shiny black hair and twitched slightly at errant hallway sounds.


She had two little black stripes curving up each side of her muzzle.


You wanted to say something, anything, but the words just wouldn't come out.


Her ears flattened in embarrassment.


"What is it? Do I have something on my face?"


She crossed her eyes toward the nose on the end of her muzzle and dabbed her thick, paw-like hands at the imagined mess on her face.


"Er... I... I mean..." was all you could sputter out before Selena remembered what she came here for. She wrapped her fuzzy, black-tipped fingers around your wrist and gave you a tug.


"Come with me."



.....




The school kept the lights off in the gym as much as possible to save money, so it was still dark this early in the morning. The dim light from the exit signs was apparently enough for Selena to see by as she lead you by the hand to a secluded spot behind the bleachers.


Your mind was reeling. Was this really Selena? What happened? And how? And what was she planning to do with you?


Selena turned back toward you. Her green eyes gave off an eerie glow as they caught glints of what little light there was in the empty gymnasium.


"You know Saturday was our six month anniversary, right?"


"Selena, I..."


Before you could voice any of your... many, many objections, Selena placed a thick, furred finger up to your mouth to silence you. You could feel a sharp claw slightly scratching the top of your lip.


"I actually don't mind that you didn't remember, but I am sad I didn't get to give you your gift."


Before you could even think of something to say, she grabbed you by the shoulders and pulled you in close, pressing her muzzle to your lips.


Her tongue had a weird, rough texture as it pushed between your teeth.


Your brain was screaming in thirty different directions at once. In the end, you decided to do the one thing that makes sense in this situation and kissed her back.


Selena responded as you leaned into her, feeling the sharp pin pricks of her teeth as your tongue slid past them.


As Selena closed her eyes, you could hear a soft purr rumbling in her chest.
