Frozen, you stand there looking right from your spot on your side of the fence, it wasn't that tall and you could easily see your best friends upper body over it, when he was standing. This was new though, you weren't expecting your friend for so long to suddenly stand there, looking like a dog. Dallas stands there, looking straight at you, blinking a moment his gaze going back and forth before he looks around to the sides of his own house.

"Jesse, you okay? Wait, is there someone doing something?" He looks around again, not finding any perpetrators, he twist back to you.

Getting a hold of yourself, you work up the nerve to give him a little smile before stepping closer to the fence. You were shaken to be true, but this was your best bud after all, though he does still look more than a little worried as he scans you carefully, one of his brown furry brows raised up inquisitively before stepping closer himself.

"Y-yeah I'm fine, Dallas, you get all that junk that was in your yard?"

Dallas curiously looks on a moment more before grinning brightly, showing off those twin rows of teeth of his, he holds up a very small bundle of sticks that he had plucked up just a few moments before and shakes them around.

"You know it, nothing all that big, to be honest, as much as my parents like our yard absolutely trim, they don't have me come out when just anything happens to it. I felt I needed to get some fresh air." He chuckles.

"Oh yeah, still doesn't stop you from being a bit of a neat freak." You snicker, to which he frowns and lets out a light snort.

Dallas smirks and steps closer still, looking down at you...

Wait, down?

You look over him again and sure enough, he was quite a bit taller than you were, you remember him being around your height last time you saw him, you certainly remember him being human as well. He was wearing a t-shirt and some shorts, his long bushy tail coming out of the back and wagging slowly behind him. Dallas' body was also a bit more toned than what you remember as well. This was all impossible though, no one could've turned into an entirely different species at the drop of a hat. It had to be a trick maybe he was wearing a costume, and this was being recorded on tv.

Your best friend opens his mouth to speak, just as you jump back to his surprise, his tall ears standing at attention as you point at him.

"This is a joke, isn't? Got a camera somewhere, maybe hidden in the bushes, right?" You say, pointing at him.

Once again, he looks puzzle and turns to look at his bushes before looking back at you, his ears swiveling around as though he were trying to listen for anything. Dallas then proceeded to sniff the air a little and walk around, soon after, he simply shook his head.

"Listen, Jesse, if there were anyone sneaking around, I would know!" He points at himself before looking curiously over you again.

"Yeah, I guess you would, but what's with the new look?" Your voice edges into worry, and after his nose twitched, Dallas seems even more bothered himself.

"New look, what new look, I've always looked like this, and you know these are my favorite shirt and shorts, bud. That's not what I'm concerned about though, are you afraid of me?" He asked, he seemed genuinely hurt at the thought of scaring you, and more than a little confused.

Trying to assuage his fears you shake your head briskly. "Of course not, just a little surprised is all."

Dallas seemed to take that for what you meant, or at least tried to mean and settled down again, his muzzle turning back up into a smirk.

"Yeah, sure. Listen, up for our usual plans?" He ask, smiling

With all this surprise of him being a dog, you had forgotten what you guys were going to do, you nod your head.

145331.content:
You barely have time to recognize the girl as Mia before your vision suddenly goes dark. Two very large, warm, soft objects are now on either side of your head, smothering you like giant bags of Jell-O. "What the-?!" You sputter out, but the fleshy prison you've been enveloped in muffles your voice so much that all that comes out is a faint "Mmph mph!"

"Oh, whoops! Sorry, Jesse!" Mia hurriedly apologizes; you feel a pair of strong hands grab onto your back and extract you from your soft suffocation, allowing you to gasp for air as you take in the new Mia.

White fur covers her skin, occasionally dappled with large black spots, and her hands each have three thick fingers and a thumb all ending in large hoof-like nails in the place of regular digits. Her legs are also different, now digitigrade and ending in large cloven hooves, and you can see a thin cow tail with a baby blue ribbon tied in it flicking at the air nervously. Her head is the most changed part of her, however - it is now unmistakably the head of a cow, complete with a small pair of horns, although the features of the face are still quite sorted, more human in shape, including the light grey eyes that you know are Mia's. But your friend's anatomical changes pale in comparison to the changes bestowed upon her figure.

Mia's body, once quite lean and boyish, is now incredibly curvy, with wide hips, a large meaty rump, and thick thighs. Her waist isn't narrow or slim, but rather quite thick and more than a little bit soft with pudge; in fact, pretty much all of her is covered in a noticeable layer of fat now. And hanging from her chest are without a doubt the largest breasts you've ever seen. Each one looks to be a bit bigger than a watermelon, straining against the fabric of her dress, and you can see her nipples, each as thick as your thumb and proudly erect, through the thin cloth. Mia's also grown much taller; she used to be about your height, but now you are just below eye level with her massive mammaries.

"...You okay there, Jesse?" Mia asks as you stare open-mouthed at her. "If you keep your mouth open any longer, you might catch a few flies." After a few more seconds, you still have yet to process the fact that your old friend is now the textbook definition of a bombshell, and your friend-turned anthro can't help but giggle.
"I swear, Jesse, you can be an absolute goof sometimes." Then she does something almost as unexpected as her transformation: She leans down and kisses you on the cheek. "And I love you for it."

...Well, this is different. You did have a bit of a crush on Mia at first, but that eventually gave way to a more platonic bond. But now she's apparently your girlfriend?! Granted, it's not that you're necessarily complaining about it - on the contrary, this is practically the stuff that your wet dreams are made of - but it's still quite the bomb to drop.
"Now, c'mon, big guy!" You hear Mia say as she takes your hand in her larger one and begins to lead you somewhere with a smile...

15231.content:
It was Friday afternoon and you had just gotten out of school and were waiting for your girlfriend Selena outside of the movie theater. Selena had been out sick for a while and you haven't seen too much of her lately. You were beginning to be afraid that she'd suspect you of finding somebody else, so you invited her to go to the movies once she was feeling better. You look at your phone at the text message that Selena sent you. She had told you that she had made a full recovery and that she would see you at the theater. However, she was still a no show. "Where on Earth could Selena be? She said that's she'd meet me here."

But as you ponder the situation, you hear loud booming noises and feel the ground shaking. "What the?!" you ask. "What's happening!? Earthquake? It can't be. The town isn't anywhere near a fault line. But something is shaking the ground. Whoa!" You fall to the ground and then you feel a large shadow on you. "Hi, Jesse." Says a familiar voice. You recognized that voice instantly. "Selena?" you ask as you stand up.

You look in utter surprise because Selena looked different somehow. She still had long black hair and she still wore glasses, but Selena was no longer human. She was now a 12ft tall brown-skinned rhinoceros with two large horns on her nose. Her body was a combination of fat in some places and pure muscle in other places and looked as if she weighed 3 tons. Her jeans and shirt were so tight on her body that they looked like they were tattooed on and her pant legs were coming apart at the seams. She was so huge that she had to bend over to be at eye level.

The sight of such a huge rhino so close to you terrified you and her front horn was dangerously close to your head. As you were trembling, Selena gave you a large kiss that enveloped most of your face and nearly caused you to groan out of fear of being suffocated. "Sorry I'm late, Jesse," says your pachyderm girlfriend. "At least I'm not late for the movie." You just continue to stare at Selena. "Selena?" you ask. "Have you noticed anything different about yourself today?" Selena snorted in confusion. "Whatever do you mean?" You see her huge rear looming in the air with her tail wagging and then bend over to get a good look under Selena's massive belly to see her huge hoofed feet and then you look back at her nose.

"How do I put this?" you ask as you twiddle your fingers. "Uh... Selena. You're an enormous rhinoceros." Selena looks at you, even more confused than before. "Yeah," said Selena. "So?" "So?! You weren't a rhinoceros last time I saw you!" Selena snorts and rises up. "Did you hit your head, Jesse? I've always been a rhinoceros." Before you can say anything, Selena takes out her wallet and shows a picture of her as a child that you remember seeing, but to your surprise, the photograph depicted her as a young rhinoceros with smaller horns than she has now.

You couldn't believe it. Were you going crazy? Have you lost your mind. You don't remember Selena ever being a big, huge and fat anthropomorphic rhinoceros until today but if the photographic is anything to go by, she's been a rhinoceros ever since the day she was born. But how could you only realize this now? And how on Earth did you wind up with a 3 ton pachyderm for a girlfriend. Before you can say anything else, your girlfriend picks you up and carries you like a handbag to the movie theater.

"So, Jesse," says your rhino girlfriend as she ducks down to go into the theater. "What are we seeing today?"
15231.title: Selena the Rhinoceros

info.brief_description: Someone's changed into an anthro, and you're the only one who seems to notice!
info.description:
You're a high school junior named Jesse, the middle child in a family of five. One day you wake up, and someone you know has somehow changed into an anthropomorphic animal version of themselves! While that's strange enough as it is, the stranger thing is that no one seems to notice except for you; everyone else reacts as if they have always been this way. How much weirder can your life get? Well, you're about to find out…

While a furry transformation is the most obvious subject here, feel free to include any other fetishes or interests! I know I will include lots of growth, as that's my favorite! Just make sure that a) whenever you introduce a new interest, you allow for different interests in the other choices, and b) while it's fine to add on other interests and fetishes on top of ones established in previous chapters, once an interest has been introduced, try keeping it a factor in subsequent chapters in that storyline.


Here's a list of some of the characters you might come across:

JESSE'S FAMILY
Jesse - MAIN CHARACTER - 17, medium-length blonde hair, average build - a creative mind and a bit of a nerd, has always had an interest in anthros - high school junior

Andy - Jesse's younger brother - 13, shaggy red hair, skinny - hyperactive and a bit of a handful, gets on Jesse's nerves sometimes but they get along. - eighth grader

Kira - Jesse's older sister - 19, long sandy-blonde hair, fit build - studious and hard-working, but knows how to have a good time - lives at home while attending community college

Wesley - Jesse's father - 39, short blonde hair, slightly overweight - a good provider for the family, usually busy with work but makes time to spend with the family when it counts - manages local office of a national insurance agency.

Melanie - Jesse's mother - 38, long red hair, average build - emphasis on cleanliness and manners, has a midwestern politeness to her that's hard to miss - stay-at-home mom.


More will be added to this list as they're added to the story.


Most importantly, HAVE FUN!
